questions.question: What is the primary material visibly composing the majority of the wine glass?
Considering the bowl's form, what best describes its overall shape?
What is the apparent color of the wine glass, excluding any reflections?
Observing the stem, what is its most prominent structural characteristic?
What is the visual texture of the glass surface, considering light reflection?
What is the apparent finish of the glass surface; is it matte, glossy, etc.?
Based solely on visual assessment, what is the overall style of the wine glass?
Examining the base, what shape does it predominantly exhibit?
Describing the bowl's curvature, is it gently rounded or sharply angled?
What is the visible thickness of the glass at the bowl's widest point?
Considering the stem's connection to the bowl, what is its design?
What is the visible design or pattern present on the glass surface?
What is the apparent condition of the glass surface; is it scratched or intact?
Does the glass show any noticeable discolorations or impurities within the material?
What is the visible form of the base where it meets the stem of the glass?
